wikipedia_page.main: Charles Thomas Clough MA, LLD, FGS, FRSE (23 December 1852 – 27 August 1916) was a prominent British geologist and mapmaker. The Edinburgh Geological Society named the Clough Medal in his honour.

response: * Charles Thomas Clough an eminent geologist, lived at St Ann's Mount, Polton with his family
* Charles Thomas Clough (1852–1916), British geologist and mapmaker

Charles Hawker Dinham BA FRSE (1883-1955) was a British geologist, cartographer and author of numerous scientific textbooks. He did much joint work with Charles Thomas Clough. He worked in both England and Scotland in the early 20th century.Proceedings of the Geological Society of London 1529 pp. 136-7 by V A Eyles, 1955
